title: Arduino Sensors & Control Structures - Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of includes, constants, LDRs, and decision-making structures in Arduino.

questions.question: What does the #include directive do in Arduino?
options: Includes external libraries or core Arduino code
questions.explanation: #include is used to bring in external libraries or Arduino’s core functionality.

questions.question: Which of these correctly includes the Servo motor library?
What is a function prototype?
options: A declaration of a function before it is defined
questions.explanation: A function prototype tells the compiler a function exists before it is defined.

questions.question: What does the const keyword do?
options: Creates a variable that can change
Creates a variable that cannot change
questions.explanation: const makes a variable value fixed so it cannot be modified after initialization.

questions.question: What type of sensor is an LDR?
questions.explanation: An LDR (Light Dependent Resistor) detects light intensity.

questions.question: What does analogRead(LDR_PIN) return?
questions.explanation: analogRead() returns values from 0 to 1023 representing voltage on the analog pin.

questions.question: Which structure runs code only if a condition is true, otherwise runs something else?
questions.explanation: if–else lets Arduino decide between two blocks of code.

questions.question: When is switch–case more useful than if–else?
options: When you have only one condition
When you need to loop infinitely
When checking many possible values of one variable
questions.explanation: switch–case is cleaner for handling multiple options of a single variable.

questions.question: What is the difference between Serial.print() and Serial.println()?
options: Serial.println() adds a new line, Serial.print() does not
questions.explanation: Serial.print() keeps printing on the same line, Serial.println() adds a newline at the end.

questions.question: If an LDR value is below LDR_LOW, what happens in the tryThisCode example?
questions.explanation: If light is below LDR_LOW, setRGBColor(255, 0, 0) makes the LED Red.
